| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [Source:SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1778](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1778 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A rot worm, w, is a monster in SLASH'EM. It is very weak, but its bite can make you [ill](/wiki/Sickness "Sickness").

## Generation

Although not normally randomly generated, spellcasting monsters can create them via [summon nasties](/wiki/Summon_nasties "Summon nasties"), meaning they are a reasonably common sight in the middle to late game. They also appear in [the Wyrm Caves](/wiki/The_Wyrm_Caves "The Wyrm Caves") and the [Lawful Quest](/wiki/Lawful_Quest "Lawful Quest").

## Strategy

Rot worms are capable of dealing delayed instadeath to any character without [sickness resistance](/wiki/Sickness_resistance "Sickness resistance"), and it is often quite easy to overlook the "deathly sick" message amidst all the other battle spam. Thus, if a [demilich](/wiki/Demilich "Demilich") summons one, be sure to use your unicorn horn after the fight, as sickness has no further messages, unlike [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning"), and it is far too easy to overlook the "Ill" indicator on the status bar.

Rot worm

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
w rot worm
Difficulty 4
Attacks Bite disease 1d2
w rot worm
Difficulty 4
Attacks

Bite disease 1d2

Base level 1
Base experience 15
Speed 9
Base AC 5
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 10
Nutritional value 10
Size Small
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A rot worm:

  • can hide under items.
  • has no limbs.
  • is an animal.
  • has a serpent body.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
Reference Source:SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1778

Thus, if a demilich summons one, be sure to use your unicorn horn after the fight, as sickness has no further messages, unlike stoning, and it is far too easy to overlook the "Ill" indicator on the status bar.

==Generation==
Although not normally randomly generated, spellcasting monsters can create them via [[summon nasties]], meaning they are a reasonably common sight in the middle to late game.  They also appear in [[the Wyrm Caves]] and the [[Lawful Quest]].

==Strategy==
Rot worms are capable of dealing delayed instadeath to any character without [[sickness resistance]], and it is often quite easy to overlook the "deathly sick" message amidst all the other battle spam.  Thus, if a [[demilich]] summons one, be sure to use your unicorn horn after the fight, as sickness has no further messages, unlike [[stoning]], and it is far too easy to overlook the "Ill" indicator on the status bar.
